h3cEponUni.name: h3cEponUni
h3cEponUni.contactinfo: Platform Team Hangzhou H3C Technologies Co., Ltd. Hai-Dian District Beijing P.R. China Http://www.h3c.com Zip:100085
h3cEponUni.description: The objects in this MIB module are used to manage and display current configuration of UNI (user network interface) which is based on the ONU(Optical Network Unit).

h3cEponUniSysManTable.name: h3cEponUniSysManTable
h3cEponUniSysManTable.description: This table defines several UNI system parameters.

h3cEponUniIndex.name: h3cEponUniIndex
h3cEponUniIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the FE(fast Ethernet) interface of the ONU.

h3cEponUniDescr.name: h3cEponUniDescr
h3cEponUniDescr.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware and software.

h3cEponUniAdminStatus.name: h3cEponUniAdminStatus
h3cEponUniAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the user network interface. When a managed system initializes, all user network interfaces start with down(2) state. The testing(3)state indicates that no operational packets can be passed. As a result of either explicit management action or per configuration information retained by the managed system, h3cEponUniAdminStatus is then changed to either the up(1) or testing(3) states (or remains in the down(2) state).

h3cEponUniMdi.name: h3cEponUniMdi
h3cEponUniMdi.description: Type of the line connected to UNI interface: mdi-ii(straight-through cable), mdi-x (crossover cable), mdi-auto (auto-sensing).

h3cEponUniPriority.name: h3cEponUniPriority
h3cEponUniPriority.description: The priority of user network interface. If the value is larger, the priority will be higher.

h3cEponUniAccessVlan.name: h3cEponUniAccessVlan
h3cEponUniAccessVlan.description: The vlan ID assigned to untagged frames or Priority-Tagged frames received on user network interface.

h3cEponUniTrunkPvid.name: h3cEponUniTrunkPvid
h3cEponUniTrunkPvid.description: PVID(port vlan ID), the vlan ID assigned to untagged frames or Priority-Tagged frames received on user network interface.

h3cEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListLow.name: h3cEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListLow
h3cEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListLow.description: Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight vlans, with the first octet specifying vlans 1 through 8, the second octet specifying vlans 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered VLAN, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered VLAN. Thus, each allowed vlan of the trunk port is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that vlan is allowed in the set of vlans. the vlan is not allowed if its bit has a value of '0'.

h3cEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListHigh.name: h3cEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListHigh
h3cEponUniVLANTrunkAllowListHigh.description: Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight vlans, with the first octet specifying vlans 2049 through 2056, the second octet specifying vlans 2057 through 2064, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered vlan, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered vlan. Thus, each allowed vlan of the trunk port is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that vlan is allowed in the set of vlans; the vlan is not allowed if its bit has a value of '0'.

h3cEponUniInboundLineRate.name: h3cEponUniInboundLineRate
h3cEponUniInboundLineRate.description: The value of the inbound line-rate. measured with kbps. The upper limit of the line-rate is the value of h3cEponUniLineRateMax in the entry. It must be multiple of the value of h3cEponUniLineRateStep. The default value of h3cEponUniLineRate is the value of h3cEponUniLineRateMax.

h3cEponUniOutboundLineRate.name: h3cEponUniOutboundLineRate
h3cEponUniOutboundLineRate.description: The value of the outbound line-rate. measured with kbps. The upper limit of the line-rate is the value of h3cEponUniLineRateMax in the entry. It must be multiple of the value of h3cEponUniLineRateStep. The default value of h3cEponUniLineRate is the value of h3cEponUniLineRateMax.

h3cEponUniFlowControl.name: h3cEponUniFlowControl
h3cEponUniFlowControl.description: Flow control status. true(1) - Flow control status enable. false(2) - Flow control status disable.

h3cEponUniVlanVPNStatus.name: h3cEponUniVlanVPNStatus
h3cEponUniVlanVPNStatus.description: vlan VPN status. true(1) - vlan VPN status enable. false(2) - vlan VPN disable.

h3cEponUniCountReset.name: h3cEponUniCountReset
h3cEponUniCountReset.description: Reset the counter which is about packets of the interface, then the counter will change to zero. There is no sense in reading this object.

h3cEponUniPortIsolate.name: h3cEponUniPortIsolate
h3cEponUniPortIsolate.description: enable - enable UNI port isolate setting. disable - disable UNI port isolate setting.

h3cEponUniVlanConfiguration.name: h3cEponUniVlanConfiguration
h3cEponUniVlanConfiguration.description: The vlan configuration of the related vlan mode. Transparent vlan mode: h3cEponUniVlanConfiguration is a zero length string. Tag vlan mode: the first four octets were the tag assigned to untagged frames received on UNI, including TPID, VID,CFI and priority. Translation vlan mode: the first four octets were the old tag (including TPID, VID, CFI and priority), which is replaced by the new tag(including TPID, VID, CFI and priority), the second four octets.

h3cEponUniAutoNegotiation.name: h3cEponUniAutoNegotiation
h3cEponUniAutoNegotiation.description: enable - enable auto negotiation. disable - disable auto negotiation.

h3cEponUniRestartAutoNeg.name: h3cEponUniRestartAutoNeg
h3cEponUniRestartAutoNeg.description: Force to restart the auto negotiation process.

h3cEponUniVitualCableTest.name: h3cEponUniVitualCableTest
h3cEponUniVitualCableTest.description: True(1): Virtual cable test enable. False(2): Virtual cable test disable.

h3cEponUniVCTCableStatus.name: h3cEponUniVCTCableStatus
h3cEponUniVCTCableStatus.description: Get the cable status. Normal(1),cable is normal. Abnormal(2),cable is abnormal. AbnormalOpen(3),cable is abnormal because of open circuit. AbnormalShort(4),cable is abnormal because of short circuit. Failure(5),cable is abnormal because of testing failure.

h3cEponUniVCTCableLength.name: h3cEponUniVCTCableLength
h3cEponUniVCTCableLength.description: Get the cable length. When h3cEponUniVCTCableStatus is normal, the node stands for the length from the UNI port to the port opposite. When h3cEponUniVCTCableStatus is abnormal, it stands for the lengh from the UNI port to the failure place. Unit:meter(m).

h3cEponUniVCTImpedanceMismatch.name: h3cEponUniVCTImpedanceMismatch
h3cEponUniVCTImpedanceMismatch.description: Get the cable impedance. Not-support(1),the UNI port does not support this function. True(2),impedance match. False(3),impedance mismatch.

h3cEponUniVCTPairSkew.name: h3cEponUniVCTPairSkew
h3cEponUniVCTPairSkew.description: Get the symmetry of cable. If the function is not supported , the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:nanosecond(ns).

h3cEponUniVCTPairSwap.name: h3cEponUniVCTPairSwap
h3cEponUniVCTPairSwap.description: NotSupport(1),the UNI port does not support this function. True(2),pair swap. False(3),not pair swap.

h3cEponUniVCTPolaritySwap.name: h3cEponUniVCTPolaritySwap
h3cEponUniVCTPolaritySwap.description: NotSupport(1),the UNI port does not support this function. True(2),polarity swap. False(3),not polarity swap.

h3cEponUniVCTInsertionLoss.name: h3cEponUniVCTInsertionLoss
h3cEponUniVCTInsertionLoss.description: If the function is not supported , the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:decibel(db).

h3cEponUniVCTReturnLoss.name: h3cEponUniVCTReturnLoss
h3cEponUniVCTReturnLoss.description: If the function is not supported , the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:decibel(db).

h3cEponUniVCTNearendCrosstalk.name: h3cEponUniVCTNearendCrosstalk
h3cEponUniVCTNearendCrosstalk.description: If the function is not supported , the default value 0 will be returned. Unit:decibel(db).

h3cEponUniCountTable.name: h3cEponUniCountTable
h3cEponUniCountTable.description: A list of interface counter about frames entries.

h3cEponUniCountEntry.name: h3cEponUniCountEntry
h3cEponUniCountEntry.description: An entry containing management information applicable to a particular interface.

h3cEponUniInStatsPkts.name: h3cEponUniInStatsPkts
h3cEponUniInStatsPkts.description: The total number of frames (including bad frames, broadcast frames, and multicast frames) received.

h3cEponUniInStatsUnicastPkts.name: h3cEponUniInStatsUnicastPkts
h3cEponUniInStatsUnicastPkts.description: The total number of good frames received that are directed to the unicast address. Note that this does not include multicast and broadcast frames.

h3cEponUniInStatsBroadcastPkts.name: h3cEponUniInStatsBroadcastPkts
h3cEponUniInStatsBroadcastPkts.description: The total number of good frames received that are directed to the broadcast address. Note that this does not include multicast frames.

h3cEponUniInStatsMulticastPkts.name: h3cEponUniInStatsMulticastPkts
h3cEponUniInStatsMulticastPkts.description: The total number of good frames received that are directed to a multicast address. Note that this number does not include frames directed to the broadcast address.

h3cEponUniInPausePkts.name: h3cEponUniInPausePkts
h3cEponUniInPausePkts.description: A count of MAC Control frames received on this interface by the pause(flow control) operation. This counter does not increment when the interface is in a half-duplex mode. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

h3cEponUniInTotalErrors.name: h3cEponUniInTotalErrors
h3cEponUniInTotalErrors.description: Total count of the error frames received on this interface.

h3cEponUniInStatsCRCAlignErrors.name: h3cEponUniInStatsCRCAlignErrors
h3cEponUniInStatsCRCAlignErrors.description: The total number of frames received that had a length (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) of between 64 and 1518 octets, inclusive, but had either a bad Frame Check Sequence (FCS) with an integral number of octets (FCS Error) or a bad FCS with a non-integral number of octets (Alignment Error).

h3cEponUniInStatsUndersizePkts.name: h3cEponUniInStatsUndersizePkts
h3cEponUniInStatsUndersizePkts.description: The total number of frames received that are less than 64 octets long (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and are otherwise well formed.

h3cEponUniInStatsOversizePkts.name: h3cEponUniInStatsOversizePkts
h3cEponUniInStatsOversizePkts.description: The total number of frames received that are longer than 1518 octets (excluding framing bits, but including FCS octets) and are otherwise well formed.

h3cEponUniInErrorbyOther.name: h3cEponUniInErrorbyOther
h3cEponUniInErrorbyOther.description: The total number of error frames received on this interface.

h3cEponUniOutStatsPkts.name: h3cEponUniOutStatsPkts
h3cEponUniOutStatsPkts.description: The total number of frames (including bad frames, broadcast frames, and multicast frames) sent.

h3cEponUniOutStatsUnicastPkts.name: h3cEponUniOutStatsUnicastPkts
h3cEponUniOutStatsUnicastPkts.description: The total number of good frames sent that are directed to the unicast address. Note that this does not include multicast and broadcast frames.

h3cEponUniOutStatsBroadcastPkts.name: h3cEponUniOutStatsBroadcastPkts
h3cEponUniOutStatsBroadcastPkts.description: The total number of good frames sent that are directed to the broadcast address. Note that this does not include multicast frames.

h3cEponUniOutStatsMulticastPkts.name: h3cEponUniOutStatsMulticastPkts
h3cEponUniOutStatsMulticastPkts.description: The total number of good frames sent that are directed to a multicast address. Note that this number does not include frames directed to the broadcast address.

h3cEponUniOutStatsPausePkts.name: h3cEponUniOutStatsPausePkts
h3cEponUniOutStatsPausePkts.description: The total number of MAC control frames sent on this interface by the pause operation. This counter does not increment when the interface is in a half-duplex mode. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system.

h3cEponUniOutTotalErrors.name: h3cEponUniOutTotalErrors
h3cEponUniOutTotalErrors.description: The total number of error frames sent on this interface.

h3cEponUniOutStatsCollisions.name: h3cEponUniOutStatsCollisions
h3cEponUniOutStatsCollisions.description: The best estimate of the total number of collisions on this Ethernet segment. The value returned will depend on the location of the RMON probe. Section 8.2.1.3 (10BASE-5) and section 10.3.1.3 (10BASE-2) of IEEE standard 802.3 states that a station must detect a collision, in the receive mode, if three or more stations are transmitting simultaneously. A repeater port must detect a collision when two or more stations are transmitting simultaneously. Thus a probe placed on a repeater port could record more collisions than a probe connected to a station on the same segment could. Probe location plays a much smaller role when considering 10BASE-T. 14.2.1.4 (10BASE-T) of IEEE standard 802.3 defines a collision as the simultaneous presence of signals on the DO and RD circuits (transmitting and receiving at the same time). A 10BASE-T station can only detect collisions when it is transmitting. Thus probes placed on a station and a repeater, should report the same number of collisions. Note also that an RMON probe inside a repeater should ideally report collisions between the repeater and one or more other hosts (transmit collisions as defined by IEEE 802.3k) plus receiver collisions observed on any coax segments to which the repeater is connected.

h3cEponUniOutDelayExceededDiscards.name: h3cEponUniOutDelayExceededDiscards
h3cEponUniOutDelayExceededDiscards.description: The number of frames discarded by this port due to excessive transit delay through the bridge. It is incremented by both transparent and source route bridges.

h3cEponUniOutErrorbyOther.name: h3cEponUniOutErrorbyOther
h3cEponUniOutErrorbyOther.description: The total number of other error frames sent on this interface. Other error frames means the error frames out of collision frames and excessive delayed frames.

h3cEponUniOutDroppedFrames.name: h3cEponUniOutDroppedFrames
h3cEponUniOutDroppedFrames.description: The total number of frames dropped because of buffer failure.

h3cEponUniIgmpInfoTable.name: h3cEponUniIgmpInfoTable
h3cEponUniIgmpInfoTable.description: This table stores igmp information of UNI interface.

h3cEponUniMacIndex.name: h3cEponUniMacIndex
h3cEponUniMacIndex.description: The index uniquely identifies the igmp information in current UNI interface.

h3cEponUniIgmpMacAddress.name: h3cEponUniIgmpMacAddress
h3cEponUniIgmpMacAddress.description: A 6-octet read-only value carrying the individual MAC address indicates which igmp group the UNI interface belonging to.

h3cEponUniIgmpVlanId.name: h3cEponUniIgmpVlanId
h3cEponUniIgmpVlanId.description: An integer range from 1 to 4094 indicates the vlan which the igmp Mac address has joined in.

h3cEponUniLineRateMax.name: h3cEponUniLineRateMax
h3cEponUniLineRateMax.description: The maximum value of the line-rate(kbps) that user network interface can be set.

h3cEponUniNumberOnOnu.name: h3cEponUniNumberOnOnu
h3cEponUniNumberOnOnu.description: The user network interface number on ONU.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyStatus.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyStatus
h3cEponUniPortPolicyStatus.description: enable - enable UNI upstream port policing. disable - disable UNI upstream port policing.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyCir.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyCir
h3cEponUniPortPolicyCir.description: The committed information rate, ranging from 1 to 102400, measured in kbps.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyBucketDepth.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyBucketDepth
h3cEponUniPortPolicyBucketDepth.description: The depth of the token bucket to tolerant the certain burst(CBS), ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyExtraBurst.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyExtraBurst
h3cEponUniPortPolicyExtraBurst.description: The extra token to permit the forwarding engine to finish the packet being sent when the bucket depth is exhausted, ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundCir.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundCir
h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundCir.description: The inbound committed information rate, measured in kbps.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundBucketDepth.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundBucketDepth
h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundBucketDepth.description: The inbound depth of the token bucket to tolerant the certain burst(CBS), ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundExtraBurst.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundExtraBurst
h3cEponUniPortPolicyInboundExtraBurst.description: The inbound extra token to permit the forwarding engine to finish the packet being sent when the bucket depth is exhausted, ranging from 0 to 65535, measured in bytes.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyOutboundCir.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyOutboundCir
h3cEponUniPortPolicyOutboundCir.description: The outbound committed information rate, stepped by 64, measured in kbps.

h3cEponUniPortPolicyOutboundPir.name: h3cEponUniPortPolicyOutboundPir
h3cEponUniPortPolicyOutboundPir.description: The outbound peak information rate, stepped by 64, measured in kbps.

h3cEponUniMulticastGroupNumber.name: h3cEponUniMulticastGroupNumber
h3cEponUniMulticastGroupNumber.description: The allowed multicast group number that can be handled at the same time by UNI.

h3cEponUniMulticastVlanList.name: h3cEponUniMulticastVlanList
h3cEponUniMulticastVlanList.description: The multicast vlan list. The first two octets of the string represent the first VLAN ID; the second two octets of the string represent the second VLAN ID, and so on. It is a zero length string by default.

h3cEponUniMulticastStripStatus.name: h3cEponUniMulticastStripStatus
h3cEponUniMulticastStripStatus.description: true - strip the vlan tag of multicast packet. false - does not strip the vlan tag of multicast packet.

h3cEponUniMulticastFastleave.name: h3cEponUniMulticastFastleave
h3cEponUniMulticastFastleave.description: true(1) - fast leave of IGMP enable on ONU. false(2) - fast leave of IGMP disable on ONU.

h3cEponUniLocalTechAbility.name: h3cEponUniLocalTechAbility
h3cEponUniLocalTechAbility.description: The local port capabilities of the UNI. Each two octets stand for a capability of UNI: the first two octets represent one capability and the second two octets represent another capability, and so on. The capabilities list: 1 - undefined, 2 - initializing, true ability not yet known, 14 - 10BASE-T, 142 - full duplex 10BASE-T, 23 - 100BASE-T4, 25 - 100BASE-TX, 252 - full duplex 100BASE-TX, 312 - PAUSE operation for full duplex links, 313 - asymmetric PAUSE operation for full duplex links, 314 - symmetric PAUSE operation for full duplex links, 32 - 100BASE-T2, 322 - full duplex 100BASE-T2, 36 - 1000BASE-X, 362 - full duplex 1000BASE-X, 40 - 1000BASE-T UTP PHY, 402 - full duplex 1000BASE-T UTP PHY, 37 - remote fault bit 1(RF1), 372 - remote fault bit 2(RF2), 8029 - 802.9ISLAN-16T.

h3cEponUniAdvertisedTechAbility.name: h3cEponUniAdvertisedTechAbility
h3cEponUniAdvertisedTechAbility.description: The advertised port capabilities of the UNI. The capabilities list references the description of h3cEponUniLocalTechAbility.

h3cEponUniMulticastControlEntry.name: h3cEponUniMulticastControlEntry
h3cEponUniMulticastControlEntry.description: The entry of the table h3cEponUniMulticastControlTable.

h3cEponUniMulticastAddressList.name: h3cEponUniMulticastAddressList
h3cEponUniMulticastAddressList.description: The multicast address, each four octets represents a multicast address, the address section ranging from the first four octets to the second four octets, and the like.

h3cEponUniMulticastAccessRule.name: h3cEponUniMulticastAccessRule
h3cEponUniMulticastAccessRule.description: deny - deny the multicast packet. permit - permit the multicast packet. preview - permit the multicast packet with conditions.

h3cEponUniMulticastChannelLimit.name: h3cEponUniMulticastChannelLimit
h3cEponUniMulticastChannelLimit.description: The limitation of multicast preview channel number.

h3cEponUniMulticastPreTimeSlice.name: h3cEponUniMulticastPreTimeSlice
h3cEponUniMulticastPreTimeSlice.description: The time slice of multicast preview.

h3cEponUniMulticastPreTimes.name: h3cEponUniMulticastPreTimes
h3cEponUniMulticastPreTimes.description: The number of multicast preview times.

h3cEponUniMulticastPreInterval.name: h3cEponUniMulticastPreInterval
h3cEponUniMulticastPreInterval.description: The interval between two consecutive previews, measured in minute.

h3cEponUniMulticastRowStatus.name: h3cEponUniMulticastRowStatus
h3cEponUniMulticastRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry. The active, createAndGo and the destory statuses are supported.

h3cEponUniMulticastSourceIpList.name: h3cEponUniMulticastSourceIpList
h3cEponUniMulticastSourceIpList.description: This list contains many source ip addresses. Each ip address is contained in four octets.

h3cEponUniMulticastResetInterval.name: h3cEponUniMulticastResetInterval
h3cEponUniMulticastResetInterval.description: The interval is measured in minute. From the last preview limitation is reached, a customer can preview again after this interval is expired.

h3cEponUniQosIndexNextEntry.name: h3cEponUniQosIndexNextEntry
h3cEponUniQosIndexNextEntry.description: The entry of the table h3cEponUniQosIndexNextTable.

h3cEponUniQosConfIndexNext.name: h3cEponUniQosConfIndexNext
h3cEponUniQosConfIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for h3cEponUniQosConfIndex when creating rows in the h3cEponUniQosConfTable.

h3cEponUniQosConfEntry.name: h3cEponUniQosConfEntry
h3cEponUniQosConfEntry.description: The entry of the table h3cEponUniQosConfTable.

h3cEponUniQosConfRuleIndexNext.name: h3cEponUniQosConfRuleIndexNext
h3cEponUniQosConfRuleIndexNext.description: This object contains an appropriate value to be used for h3cEponUniQosRuleIndex when creating rows in the h3cEponUniQosRuleTable.

h3cEponUniQosConfMappedQueue.name: h3cEponUniQosConfMappedQueue
h3cEponUniQosConfMappedQueue.description: The queue that the ethernet frames will be mapped.

h3cEponUniQosConfMarkedPriority.name: h3cEponUniQosConfMarkedPriority
h3cEponUniQosConfMarkedPriority.description: Priority of the ethernet frames to be marked, which compliant with the 802.1D user priority standard.

h3cEponUniQosConfRowStatus.name: h3cEponUniQosConfRowStatus
h3cEponUniQosConfRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry. The active, createAndGo and the destory statuses are supported.

h3cEponUniQosRuleTable.name: h3cEponUniQosRuleTable
h3cEponUniQosRuleTable.description: Qos sub rule of the UNI.

h3cEponUniQosRuleEntry.name: h3cEponUniQosRuleEntry
h3cEponUniQosRuleEntry.description: The entry of the table h3cEponUniQosRuleTable.

h3cEponUniQosRuleSelector.name: h3cEponUniQosRuleSelector
h3cEponUniQosRuleSelector.description: The ethernet frame selector. dstmac - based on destination MAC address. srcmac - based on source MAC address. ethernetpriority - based on ethernet priority. vlanid - based on VLAN ID. ethernettype - based on ethernet type. dstip - based on destination IP address. srcip - based on source IP address. ipprototype - based on IP type(ipv4 or ipv6). ipv4tosdscp - based on IP TOS/DSCP. ipv6 - based IP precedence. srcport - based on layer 4 source port. dstport - based on layer 4 destination port.

h3cEponUniQosRuleValue.name: h3cEponUniQosRuleValue
h3cEponUniQosRuleValue.description: The rule value based on the h3cEponUniQosRuleSelector.

h3cEponUniQosRuleOperator.name: h3cEponUniQosRuleOperator
h3cEponUniQosRuleOperator.description: nervermatch - value never match. equal - field equal to the value. notequal - field not equal to the value. lessthanequal - field less than or equal to the value. greaterthanequal - field greater than or equal to the value. fieldexist - value is ignored if field exists. fieldnotexist - value is ignored if field does not exist. alwaysmatch - value always match.

h3cEponUniQosRuleRowStatus.name: h3cEponUniQosRuleRowStatus
h3cEponUniQosRuleRowStatus.description: The status of this table entry. Only active, createAndGo and the destory are supported.

h3cEponUniMirrorGroupTable.name: h3cEponUniMirrorGroupTable
h3cEponUniMirrorGroupTable.description: Qos sub rule of the UNI.

h3cEponUniMirrorInboundPortList.name: h3cEponUniMirrorInboundPortList
h3cEponUniMirrorInboundPortList.description: UNI inbound port list. Each octet within this value specifies a set of eight ports, with the first octet specifying ports 1 through 8, the second octet specifying ports 9 through 16, etc. Within each octet, the most significant bit represents the highest numbered UNI, and the least significant bit represents the lowest numbered UNI. Thus, each UNI port is represented by a single bit within the value of this object. If that bit has a value of '1' then that port is allowed in the set of ports. the port is not allowed if its bit has a value of '0'.
